org.openntf.domino
Interface Log

All Superinterfaces:
Base, Log, SessionDescendant
public interface Log
extends Base<lotus.domino.Log>, Log, SessionDescendant

The Interface Log nnables you to record actions and errors that take place during a program's execution. You can record actions and errors in

  • A Domino database
  • A mail memo
  • A file (for programs that run locally)
  • An agent log (for agents)

The number of actions logged so far.

Returns:

Since:

getNumErrors

int getNumErrors()
The number of errors logged so far.

The NumErrors property is not incremented until after logError(int, java.lang.String) is called. To get the correct count at the time of a call to logError, increment getNumErrors by 1.

Returns:
The number of errors as an Integer
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

java.lang.String getProgramName()
The name that identifies the agent whose actions and errors you're logging. The name is the same as the name specified with

Returns:
The name of the log object. Session.createLog(java.lang.String).
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isLogActions

boolean isLogActions()
Indicates if action logging is enabled or not.

The logAction(java.lang.String) method has no effect while the isLogActions property is false.

Returns:
Returns true if action logging is enabled, otherwise returns false
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isLogErrors

boolean isLogErrors()
Indicates if error logging is enabled or not.

The logError(int, java.lang.String) method has no effect while the IsLogErrors property is false.

Returns:
Returns true if error logging is enabled, otherwise returns false
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isOverwriteFile

boolean isOverwriteFile()
For a log that records to a file, indicates if the log should write over the existing file or append to it.

This property has no effect on logs that record to a mail message or database.

Returns:
Returns true if overwriting is enabled, otherwise returns false
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

logAction

void logAction(java.lang.String action)
Records an action in a log.

The behavior of this method depends upon the type of log you open.

If you open a Domino database using openNotesLog, this method creates a new document in the database. The A$ACTION item in the document contains the description.

If you open a mail memo using openMailLog, this method adds the description to the Body item of the memo, along with the current date and time.

If you open a file using openFileLog, this method adds the description to the next line of the file, along with the log's ProgramName and the current date and time.

Parameters:
action - A description of the action, as you want it to appear in the log.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

logError

void logError(int code,
              java.lang.String text)
Records an error in a log.

The behavior of this method depends upon the type of log you open.

If you open a Domino database using openNotesLog, this method creates a new document in the database. The A$ERRMSG item in the document contains the description.

If you open a mail memo using openMailLog, this method adds the description to the Body item of the memo, along with the current date and time.

If you open a file using openFileLog, this method adds the description to the next line of the file, along with the log's ProgramName and the current date and time.

Parameters:
code - A number indicating which error occurred.
text - A description of the action, as you want it to appear in the log.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

logEvent

void logEvent(java.lang.String text,
              java.lang.String queue,
              int event,
              int severity)
Sends a Domino event out to the network.

Parameters:
text - The message to send to the network.
queue - The name of the queue. The queue is picked for you if you send an empty string.
event - Indicates the kind of event being logged.
severity - Indicates the severity of the event being logged.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

openAgentLog

void openAgentLog()
Opens the agent log for the current agent.

This method stores output in the log for the current agent and fails if the program is not running as an agent. To display an agent log, select the agent and choose Agent > Log. The log also displays after you run an agent with Actions > Run.

Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

openFileLog

void openFileLog(java.lang.String filePath)
Starts logging to a file.

This method returns an error if you call it on a server.

To write over an existing log file, you must set the setOverwriteFile(boolean) property to true before calling openFileLog.

Parameters:
filePath - The path and file name of the log file. If the file does not exist, the method creates it for you. If a directory in the path does not exist, the method throws an exception.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

openMailLog

void openMailLog(java.util.Vector recipients,
                 java.lang.String subject)
Opens a new mail memo for logging.

The memo is mailed when the log's close method is called, or when the object is deleted.

When you call this method, Domino uses the current user's mail database to create and send the mail memo. The memo is not saved to the database.

Parameters:
recipients - The recipients of the mail memo. Each element is an object of type String.
subject - The subject of the mail memo.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

openNotesLog

void openNotesLog(java.lang.String server,
                  java.lang.String database)
Opens a specified Domino� database for logging.

The StdR4AgentLog template (ALOG4.NTF) is designed to display the action and error documents that Log creates. If the database you specify inherits its design from this template, you can use the database main view to see each of the items previously listed. Several agents can log to the same server and database; the database categorizes each action and error according to the A$PROGNAME item.

One document is created in the database for each error or action that you log. Each document contains the following items:

    Form - "Log Entry"
  • AA$PROGNAME The ProgramName property
  • A$LOGTIME The date and time that the error or action is logged
  • A$USER The user at the time the error or action is logged
  • A$LOGTYPE "Error" or "Action"
  • A$ACTION A description of the action (actions only)
  • A$ERRCODE The error code (errors only)
  • A$ERRMSG A description of the error (errors only)

Parameters:
server - The server on which the database log resides. Use null or an empty string to indicate the current computer: a local database if the agent runs on a workstation; a database on that server if the agent runs on a server.
database - The path and file name of the database.

setLogActions

void setLogActions(boolean flag)
Sets if action logging is enabled or not.

The logAction(java.lang.String) method has no effect while the isLogActions property is false.

Parameters:
flag - Set to true if action logging should be enabled, otherwise set to false
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setLogErrors

void setLogErrors(boolean flag)
Sets if error logging is enabled or not.

The logError(int, java.lang.String) method has no effect while the isLogErrors property is false.

Parameters:
flag - Set to true if error logging should be enabled, otherwise set to false
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

void setOverwriteFile(boolean flag)
Sets if file overwriting is enabled or not.

Parameters:
flag - Set to true if log file overwriting should be enabled, otherwise set to false
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

void setProgramName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name that identifies the agent whose actions and errors you're logging.

Parameters:

Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0
